PolicyPage.Title: Pathway Matriculation Options
PolicyPage.BodyCopy:
Pathway students that do not meet the 3.0 cumulative GPA need to retake an academic start class to raise their GPA.  Pathway student cannot matriculate with having less than a 3.0 cumulative GPA but obtaining a 16 on their ACT.  If a Pathway student would like to come to campus, they must fulfill all the requirements and they will forfeit their Pathway tuition. In order for a Pathway student to apply for campus they should select that they are a transfer student with less than 24 credits (in most cases).

Pathway Attendance Winter 2013
In addition to the spiritually and socially empowering experiences available on Thursday evenings, meeting together each week during the first year also satisfies the university's residency requirement. This will allow students to apply to the BYU-Idaho Online Degree program after Academic Start.

Pathway students are expected to attend all gatherings during the semester. They should plan their schedule accordingly and make any necessary arrangements to attend the Thursday gatherings.

If students do not attend a gathering, they will lose attendance points in the course. The other online course assignments related to that week's lesson activities can still be submitted through I-Learn as usual. 

In addition to losing attendance points, additional penalties will apply if absence becomes a habit. If students miss four gatherings during the semester, their final grade will be reduced by one full letter grade. If students miss five or more gatherings during the semester, they will fail the course.

In very rare instances, Pathway missionaries may cancel a gathering due to extreme weather or other unsafe situations. If such a situation occurs, this will not count against a student as an absence, but they will need to notify their online instructors. Any other attendance related questions should be directed to students' online instructors.
